III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iii)Threats of restraint, seclusion, punishment, or otherwise
suggesting physical or emotional harm to a youth.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Two different staff threatened to slap Youth I.
Investigation I exchanged emails with Complainant. He received the
information from Youth I while he was interviewing her on 5/31/23
and expressed no additional concerns about the facility.
I notified Rights Officer of the allegations.
I reviewed the facility’s history of licensing rule violations.
I notified Foster Care worker that I was assigned this investigation.
She expressed no additional concerns about staff at the facility.
I interviewed Rights Officer on 6/1/2023. On 5/24/23 he said he
addressed Youth I’s verbal grievance alleging Team Leader and
Staff 1 threatened to slap her and found no evidence that it
occurred. Rights Officer said he interviewed both staff on 5/25/23,
both of them denied the allegations and there were no other
known witnesses.
I interviewed Youth I on 6/6/23 with Quality Manager present. She
has been at the facility for approximately one month. A few weeks
ago on B wing, she said Team Leader told her she’d slap her face
because she was behaving badly and had not gone to school.
Youth I said no one else heard Team Leader threaten her.
Another day on B wing, Youth I said she was argumentative and
disrespectful toward Staff 1. “Staff 1 got an attitude and said, ‘I’ll
beat you and slap you.’” And no one witnessed this interaction.
Shortly after Youth I was moved to another wing – B wing.
I interviewed Team Leader with Quality Manager present. She
has worked at the facility for over six years. Team Leader works
2

on B wing and passes medication to all youths in the building. A
while back, she said Youth I was negatively influencing other
youths on B wing. Shortly after that, the youth was moved to
another wing. Team Leader denied ever threatening Youth I.
I interviewed Staff 1 with Quality Manager present. She has
worked at the facility on B wing for five months. Staff 1 recalled
the incident that occurred a few weeks ago on B wing. She said
she was monitoring a youth on 1:1 and Youth I was provoking the
youth she was supervising. “I asked Youth I to move away.
Team Leader also asked her to move. Youth I was defiant and
would not stop provoking her peer. I did not threaten to slap her
but her peer, Youth C, did…Youth I was moved (to A wing) that
same day.”
I interviewed Unit Manager with Quality Manager present. I asked
why Youth I was moved from B wing to A wing. She said youths
are moved to different wings for various reasons. She could not
recall the exact reason Youth I was moved from B to A wing,
however, she said it was not due to the allegations made against
Team Leader or Staff 1.
I interviewed Youth C with Quality Manager present. She has
been at the facility for five months. Youth C recalled the incident
clearly. “Youth I was not following directions and refused school.
She was in the (general) area. Staff 1 approached Youth I and
Youth I argued with her. Staff 1 never said she would smack
Youth I. It was me. I looked in Youth I’s face and told her I was
going to smack her.”
Neither Team Leader nor Staff 1 have any disciplinary write-ups in
their employee files.
Analysis Team Leader, Staff 1 and Youth C denied that Team Leader
and/or Staff 1 threatened to slap Youth I. Rather, upon interview,
Youth C admitted that she was the one who threatened to “smack”
Youth I.
Conclusion Violation Not Established

licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
